trans-unit.source: Add Appveyor hosted CI setup for running tests on Windows (GH-347)

trans-unit.source: Add Dockerfile and a Docker image and instructions on how to use it (GH-258). This could be a convenient way to use pymssql without having to build stuff. See http://pymssql.readthedocs.org/en/latest/intro.html#docker Thanks Marc Abramowitz.
trans-unit.target: Add Dockerfile and a Docker image and instructions on how to use it (GH-258). This could be a convenient way to use pymssql without having to build stuff. See http://pymssql.readthedocs.org/en/latest/intro.html#docker Thanks Marc Abramowitz.

trans-unit.source: Add ability to set TDS protocol version from pymssql when connecting to SQL Server. For the remaining pymssql 2.1.x releases its default value will be 7.1 (GH-323)
trans-unit.target: SQL Serverに接続する際に、pymssqlからTDSプロトコルのバージョンを設定する機能を追加しました。残りの pymssql 2.1.x リリースでは、デフォルト値は 7.1 (GH-323)になります。

trans-unit.source: Fix a couple of very common causes of segmentation faults in presence of network a partition between a pymssql-based app and SQL Server (GH-147, GH-271) Thanks Marc Abramowitz. See also GH-373.
trans-unit.target: pymssqlベースのアプリとSQL Server間のパーティションがネットワークに存在する場合のセグメンテーション障害の非常に一般的な原因を修正しました(GH-147,GH-271)。GH-373も参照してください。

trans-unit.source: Lets you use pymssql with cooperative multi-tasking systems like gevent and have pymssql call a callback when it is waiting for a response from the server. You can set this callback to yield to another greenlet, coroutine, etc. For example, for gevent, you could do:
trans-unit.target: pymssqlをgeventのような協調的なマルチタスクシステムと組み合わせて使用し、pymssqlがサーバからの応答を待っているときにコールバックを呼び出すようにします。このコールバックを他のグリーンレットやコルーチンなどに渡すように設定することができます。例えば、gevent の場合は以下のようにします。

trans-unit.source: The DB-Library API includes a callback mechanism so applications can provide functions known as message handlers that get passed informative messages sent by the server which then can be logged, shown to the user, etc.
trans-unit.target: The DB-Library API includes a callback mechanism so applications can provide functions known as message handlers that get passed informative messages sent by the server which then can be logged, shown to the user, etc.

trans-unit.source: The above is useful if you’re say, running a gunicorn server with the gevent worker. With this callback in place, when you send a query to SQL server and are waiting for a response, you can yield to other greenlets and process other requests. This is super useful when you have high concurrency and/or slow database queries and lets you use less gunicorn worker processes and still handle high concurrency.
trans-unit.target: The above is useful if you’re say, running a gunicorn server with the gevent worker. With this callback in place, when you send a query to SQL server and are waiting for a response, you can yield to other greenlets and process other requests. This is super useful when you have high concurrency and/or slow database queries and lets you use less gunicorn worker processes and still handle high concurrency.

trans-unit.source: The value returned for TDS version 7.1 is still 8.0 for backward compatibility (this is because such feature got added in times when Microsoft documentation labeled the two protocol versions that followed 7.0 as 8.0 and 9.0; later it changed them to 7.1 and 7.2 respectively) and will be corrected in a future release (2.2).
trans-unit.target: TDSバージョン7.1で返される値は、後方互換性のために8.0のままです(これは、Microsoftドキュメントが7.0に続く2つのプロトコルバージョンを8.0と9.0と表記していた時代にこのような機能が追加されたためで、後にそれぞれ7.1と7.2に変更されました)。

trans-unit.source: The version number is now stored in one place, in pymssql_version.h This makes it easier to update the version number and not forget any places, like I did with pymssql 2.0.1
trans-unit.target: バージョン番号はpymssql_version.hに一箇所に格納されるようになりました。これで、pymssql 2.0.1の時のように、バージョン番号を更新しやすくなり、忘れ物をしないようになりました。

trans-unit.source: There is a Google Group for discussion at:
trans-unit.target: で議論するためのGoogleグループがあります。

trans-unit.source: There was a rather large amount of type conversion occuring when fetching a row from pymssql. The number of conversions required have been cut down significantly with these changes. Thanks Damien, Churchill!
trans-unit.target: pymssqlから行を取得する際に、かなり大量の型変換が発生していました。これらの変更により、必要とされる変換の数が大幅に削減されました。ありがとうDamien、Churchill!
これは

trans-unit.source: This drops the previous method of building up a row tuple and switches to using the CPython API, which allows you to create a correctly sized tuple at the beginning and simply fill it in. This appears to offer around a 10% boost when fetching rows from a table where the data is already in memory. Thanks Damien, Churchill!
trans-unit.target: これまでの行タプルを構築する方法をやめて、CPython APIを使うようになりました。これにより、データが既にメモリに入っているテーブルから行を取得する際に、10%程度の向上が期待できるようです。Damienさん、Churchillさん、ありがとうございました。

trans-unit.source: Travis CI: Use newer, faster, container-based infrastructure. Also, test against more than one FreeTDS version.
trans-unit.target: Travis CI:より新しく、より高速で、コンテナベースのインフラストラクチャを使用してください。また、複数の FreeTDS バージョンに対してもテストしてください。

trans-unit.source: Underlying FreeTDS must be 0.95 or newer.
trans-unit.target: 基礎となるFreeTDSは0.95以降のものでなければなりません。

trans-unit.source: Use the bytesarray type added in Python 2.6 to signify that this is binary data and to quote it accordingly. Also modify the handling of str/bytes types checking the first 2 characters for b’0x’ and insert that as binary data. See:
trans-unit.target: Use the bytesarray type added in Python 2.6 to signify that this is binary data and to quote it accordingly. Also modify the handling of str/bytes types checking the first 2 characters for b’0x’ and insert that as binary data. See:

trans-unit.source: because the previous behavior was very confusing; instead of raising an exception, we would just return row dicts with those columns missing. This prompted at least one question on the mailing list (https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/pymssql/JoZpmNZFtxM), so we thought it was better to handle this explicitly by raising an exception, so the user would understand what went wrong.
trans-unit.target: because the previous behavior was very confusing; instead of raising an exception, we would just return row dicts with those columns missing. This prompted at least one question on the mailing list (https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/pymssql/JoZpmNZFtxM), so we thought it was better to handle this explicitly by raising an exception, so the user would understand what went wrong.
